org.spongepowered.api.util.command

Interface CommandSource

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Subject
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CommandBlock, CommandBlockSource, ConsoleSource, MinecartCommandBlock, Player, RemoteSource

    public interface CommandSource
extends Subject
    Something that can execute commands.

    Examples of potential implementations include players, the server console, RCON clients, web-based clients, command blocks, and so on.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name identifying this command source.
      void sendMessage(java.lang.Iterable<Message> messages)
      Sends the formatted text message(s) to source when possible.

      Sends the formatted text message(s) to source when possible.
      void sendMessage(java.lang.String... messages)
      Sends the plain text message(s) to source when possible.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name identifying this command source.
        Returns:
        The name of this command source

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(java.lang.String... messages)
        Sends the plain text message(s) to source when possible.

        Use sendMessage(Message...) for a formatted message.

        Parameters:
        messages - The message(s)

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(Message... messages)
        Sends the formatted text message(s) to source when possible. If text formatting is not supported in the implementation it will be displayed as plain text.
        Parameters:
        messages - The message(s)

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(java.lang.Iterable<Message> messages)
        Sends the formatted text message(s) to source when possible. If text formatting is not supported in the implementation it will be displayed as plain text.
        Parameters:
        messages - The messages
